Question: Around the start of the 20th century, members of the literary elite reacted against the popularization of this person.
Hints: After finishing Lady Susan, this person attempted her first full-length novel — Elinor and Marianne.
In early 1803, Henry **** offered Susan to Benjamin Crosby, a London publisher, who paid £10 for the copyright.
In October 1833, Bentley published the first collected edition of this person's works.
